hanzi-su-wiki:
陣

Значения

Военный лагерь, позиция

Мнемоника

Круговая оборона на ночь за стеной 阝 повозок 車 на ночь.

Варианты

阵

zhèn
disposition of troops; wave; spate; burst; spell; short period of time; classifier for events or states of short duration
расположение войск; волна; всплеск; лопаться; заклинание; короткий промежуток времени; классификатор событий или кратковременных состояний

purpleculture_examples:
陣地 [ zhèn dì ]: position; front
陣容 [ zhèn róng ]: troop arrangement; battle formation; lineup (of a sports team etc)
陣線 [ zhèn xiàn ]: a front (militant group); line of battle; alignment (towards a political party etc)

heisig_chinese_memo: Paparazzi make camp outside of The Pinnacle in their cars as if in a battle formation, waiting for the celebs to come out.
koohiiStory1: Paparazzi make camp outside of The Pinnacle in their cars, waiting for the celebs to come out.
koohiiStory2: Note: This kanji is most often used in a military context. Story: Here we see an encampment of military vehicles laying siege to The Pinnacle. With other countries being envious of the perfect life they lead there that makes sense. Fortunately, the pinnacle knows how to ward off (#1302) enemies.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This building is full of cars because it's an army base. The cars (and tanks and planes) need to be ready to go at any moment just like the soldiers.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture a giant army base housing all of the different cars the army needs at any given time.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All of the people in the army base are wearing jeans (じん). You thought soldiers were supposed to wear uniforms, but it looks like when they're on the base they have to wear jeans.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Jeans are pretty durable, now that you think about it. And if the soldiers are working on these cars in the base while they're there, it makes sense to wear a nice pair of jeans.
Ru_Russian: позиция, боевой порядок, расположение, построение, лагерь, группировка
Ru_Meaning: camp, battle array, ranks, position, sudden, brief time
Ru_trainchinese:
zhèn: (сч.слово) отрезок времени; короткий период времени, приступ
zhèn: (графема) (устар.) расположение или построение войск; битва, фронт
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the car (車) on the hill (⻖) is in the camp
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When the pinnacle is under attach the army surrounds the city with their cars in a battle formation.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " Fu " and " East ", the original meaning is battle formation and formation. " Array " is often represented by "敶" and " Chen ". Today's " array " is a corruption of " Chen ", refer to " Chen ". "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language Six": "Chu half-array, the minister hits it." Li Daoyuan of the Northern Wei Dynasty, "Shui Jingzhu-Weishui": "The old Han Xin and the Chu Jianglong together, sandwiched the Weishui." Song History-Yue Fei Biography": "Fei said: "The battle after the battle, the constant use of the art of war, the magic of the use of one heart." Ze is the word."

" Array " also means position. "Historical Records: The Biography of Zhang Yi": "The great king tasted a battle with Wu people, five battles and three victories, and the battle was exhausted." Jin Luji "On the death of death": "The soldiers are scattered in the battle. The people rush to the town, the city has no fences, and the mountains and rivers have no ditch." "Song History·Song Qi Biography": "If the king is conquered in the future, even if he is captured on the battlefield, he must be loaned to his death. Make it grace."

" Array " is also used as a quantifier to indicate the period of time that things have passed. Former Shu Maowenxi's poem "Drunk Flower Room": "Last night it rained, and it was cold in the Ming Dynasty. I remember the people in the tower, and I have never heard from the court for a long time." Song Zhang Ji's poem "Pointing the lips ‧ Nanpu Moon": "Let's cut Ulva Silk, there was a blast of rain over the river. The lonely canopy returned home, blowing the wind into the evening."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " Fu " and " East ", the original meaning is battle formation and formation.
humanum_full_description:
從「阜」，「東」聲，本義為戰陣，布陣。「陣」多用「敶」、「陳」表示。今天的「陣」為「陳」訛變而成，參考「陳」。《國語‧晉語六》：「楚半陣，公使擊之。」北魏酈道元《水經注‧濰水》：「昔韓信與楚將龍且，夾濰水而陣於此。」《宋史‧岳飛傳》：「飛曰：『陣而後戰，兵法之常，運用之妙，存乎一心。』澤是其言。」

　　「陣」也表示陣地，《史記‧張儀列傳》：「大王嘗與吳人戰，五戰而三勝，陣卒盡矣。」晉陸機〈辨亡論上〉：「卒散于陣，民奔于邑，城池無藩籬之固，山川無溝阜之勢。」《宋史‧宋琪傳》：「如將來王師討伐，雖臨陣擒獲，必貸其死，命署置存撫，使之懷恩。」

　　「陣」也用作量詞，表示事物經過的時間段。前蜀毛文錫詞〈醉花間〉：「昨夜雨霏霏，臨明寒一陣。偏憶戍樓人，久絕邊庭信。」宋張輯詞《點絳唇‧南浦月》：「來剪蓴絲，江頭一陣鳴蓑雨。孤篷歸路，吹得蘋風暮。」
humanum_short_description: 從「阜」，「東」聲，本義為戰陣，布陣。

陣陣RS
阵阵 		column, row or file of troops, camp, short time
  • troops with carts 車 ready to attack a wall 阝; they set up camp at the base and will attack in a short time
(Simplified: 阵)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A formation 阝of soldiers 車
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 阝 [ yì ] place, town, city
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
①[析字］(會意。從阜(fù)，從車。土山前擺滿了戰車。字本作“陳”。“陣”爲後起字。本義：兩軍交戰時隊伍的戰鬥隊形)。
②用本義。［例］信乃使萬人先行，出背水陣。——《史記·淮陰侯傳》。［例］先登陷陣。——《史記·樊噲傳》。［合］陣腳(戰陣的前沿陣地)；陣圓(戰陣佈置完畢)；陣圖(作戰時所擺列的軍陣圖形)；陣梢(戰鬥隊列的尾端)；陣殺(軍中誅殺)。
③陣地。［例］大王嘗與吳人戰，五戰而三勝，陣卒盡矣。——《史記》。
④陣歿(在戰場上死去；陣亡)；陣場(戰場)；陣門(軍營之門)；陣俘(戰場上俘獲的敵兵)；陣雲(戰地氣氛，戰陣煙雲。又稱“戰雲”)。
⑤又指戰爭或戰鬥。［例］鮮于仲通六萬卒，徵蠻一陣全軍沒。——唐·白居易《蠻子朝》。［合］陣陣贏(仗仗取勝)；叫陣；怯陣；出陣；陣敗(戰敗)；陣率(戰士)。
⑥雷陣雨來臨前烏雲翻滾、雷電交加的現象。［例］陣急如酣戰，點粗成亂漚。——唐·李鹹用《和殷衙推春霖即事》。［合］陣頭雨(雷陣雨)；陣影(陣雲的陰影)。
陣地 [ zhèn dì ]: position; front
陣容 [ zhèn róng ]: troop arrangement; battle formation; lineup (of a sports team etc)
陣線 [ zhèn xiàn ]: a front (militant group); line of battle; alignment (towards a political party etc)

從「 阜 」，「 東 」聲，本義為戰陣，布陣。「 陣 」多用「 敶 」、「 陳 」表示。今天的「 陣 」為「 陳 」訛變而成，參考「 陳 」。《國語‧晉語六》：「楚半陣，公使擊之。」北魏酈道元《水經注‧濰水》：「昔韓信與楚將龍且，夾濰水而陣於此。」《宋史‧岳飛傳》：「飛曰：『陣而後戰，兵法之常，運用之妙，存乎一心。』澤是其言。」 「 陣 」也表示陣地，《史記‧張儀列傳》：「大王嘗與吳人戰，五戰而三勝，陣卒盡矣。」晉陸機〈辨亡論上〉：「卒散于陣，民奔于邑，城池無藩籬之固，山川無溝阜之勢。」《宋史‧宋琪傳》：「如將來王師討伐，雖臨陣擒獲，必貸其死，命署置存撫，使之懷恩。」 「 陣 」也用作量詞，表示事物經過的時間段。前蜀毛文錫詞〈醉花間〉：「昨夜雨霏霏，臨明寒一陣。偏憶戍樓人，久絕邊庭信。」宋張輯詞《點絳唇‧南浦月》：「來剪蓴絲，江頭一陣鳴蓑雨。孤篷歸路，吹得蘋風暮。」
From the sound of " Fu" and " East", the original meaning is battle formation and formation. " Array" is often represented by " 敶" and " Chen". Today's " array" is a corruption of " Chen", refer to " Chen". "Mandarin ‧ Jin Language Six": "Chu half-array, the minister hits it." Li Daoyuan of the Northern Wei Dynasty, "Shui Jingzhu-Weishui": "The old Han Xin and the Chu Jianglong together, sandwiched the Weishui." Song History-Yue Fei Biography": "Fei said: "The battle after the battle, the constant use of the art of war, the magic of the use of one heart." Ze is the word." " Array" also means position. "Historical Records: The Biography of Zhang Yi": "The great king tasted a battle with Wu people, five battles and three victories, and the battle was exhausted." Jin Luji "On the death of death": "The soldiers are scattered in the battle. The people rush to the town, the city has no fences, and the mountains and rivers have no ditch." "Song History·Song Qi Biography": "If the king is conquered in the future, even if he is captured on the battlefield, he must be loaned to his death. Make it grace." " Array" is also used as a quantifier to indicate the period of time that things have passed. Former Shu Maowenxi's poem "Drunk Flower Room": "Last night it rained, and it was cold in the Ming Dynasty. I remember the people in the tower, and I have never heard from the court for a long time." Song Zhang Ji's poem "Pointing the lips ‧ Nanpu Moon": "Let's cut Ulva Silk, there was a blast of rain over the river. The lonely canopy returned home, blowing the wind into the evening."

Liushutong characters (3)

陣字的基本解释

陣
zhèn
见“阵”。

陣字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhèn］
［《廣韻》直刃切，去震，澄。］
亦作“塦1”。“敶2”的被通假字。“阵1”的繁体字。亦作“陳2”。
(1)军伍行列，战斗队形。
(2)列阵；布阵。
(3)引申为驻扎，屯兵。
(4)阵地；战场。
(5)战役。
(6)雷阵雨来临前乌云翻滚、电闪雷鸣的现象。
(7)成群结队貌。
(8)量词。用于表示事物或动作经过的一定时间段落。
(9)量词。群；伙。

陣字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【阜字部】　陣； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1352第06
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?直刃切，音?。【玉篇】旅也。【廣韻】列也。【史記·淮隂侯傳】信乃使萬人先行出，背水陣。【後漢·禮儀志】兵官皆肄孫吳兵法六十四陣。　又【玉篇】本作?。【周禮·夏官·大司馬】中春敎振旅，司馬以旗致民平列?，如戰之?。【左傳·成七年】巫臣通吳於晉，敎之戰?。【佩觿集】軍?爲陣，始於王羲之小學章。◎按史記作陣，非自羲之始也。

陣字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
陣字的起名意思

暂无。

zhèn
вм. 阵
Radicals: 阝, 車  (building, car)
Meaning Mnemonic
This building is full of cars because it's an army base. The cars (and tanks and planes) need to be ready to go at any moment just like the soldiers.
Picture a giant army base housing all of the different cars the army needs at any given time.
Reading Mnemonic
All of the people in the army base are wearing jeans (じん). You thought soldiers were supposed to wear uniforms, but it looks like when they're on the base they have to wear jeans.
Jeans are pretty durable, now that you think about it. And if the soldiers are working on these cars in the base while they're there, it makes sense to wear a nice pair of jeans.

阡, 車 (автомобиль)
